42nd Circuit Court - Family Division

Midland, MI 48642
RE: License #: CA560234172
42nd Circuit Court - Family Division
3712 E Ashman Street
Midland, MI 48642
Dear Ms. Woods:
Your Child Placing Agency certificate of authorization license is renewed. It is valid only
at your present address and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least
30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the certificate of authorization in the mail. Please review it for
accuracy.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (866) 685-0006.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
This agency is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
This agency is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services, therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None needed.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has not submitted any acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. No corrective action plans have been
required.
Trends and Repeat Violation Assessment
No violations.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
I recommend authorization of this approved governmental unit.
